intro: Eupatorium moritense, commonly known as white boneset, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stem and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks, thriving in moist to wet soil conditions. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have a rough texture. Eupatorium moritense is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
